The Hubble Space Telescope, launched in 1990, has provided unprecedented deep space images and data, significantly advancing our understanding of the universe. Its observations have led to breakthroughs in astrophysics, such as determining the rate of expansion of the universe. Hubble's data has also been instrumental in studying distant galaxies and their evolution. Despite its successes, the telescope's operations are limited by its location in low Earth orbit.
